summary: The "Have I Been Rekt?" project by Pretty Good OSINT Protocol (PGOP) aims to democratize access to open-source intelligence tools, traditionally limited to governments and corporations. The project offers a modular, privacy-respecting OSINT framework that integrates AI automation, blockchain transparency, and privacy-preserving technologies. It targets journalists, activists, researchers, and ethical hackers, providing tools for face recognition, wallet tracing, contract analysis, and more. The project emphasizes open-source principles, privacy by design, and aims to enhance the OSS ecosystem by making advanced OSINT tools accessible to the public.
review: The "Have I Been Rekt?" project presents a compelling case for funding within the GG23 OSS - dApps and Apps round. The project aligns well with the round's goals of enhancing Web3 accessibility and usability, contributing to financial inclusion, education, and social impact. The project demonstrates a strong commitment to open-source principles, offering a modular OSINT framework that is both privacy-respecting and highly customizable. The integration of AI and blockchain technologies showcases innovation and potential for broad, scalable impact. However, the application could benefit from more detailed information on user-centric design and specific metrics for measuring impact. Additionally, while the project outlines a clear development roadmap, further clarity on the allocation of grant funds and expected outcomes would strengthen the application.

strengths.title: Innovative Use of AI and Blockchain
strengths.description: The project integrates AI automation and blockchain transparency, offering innovative solutions for open-source intelligence gathering.

strengths.title: Commitment to Open-Source Principles
strengths.description: The project is fully open-source, encouraging community contributions and ensuring transparency and accessibility.

strengths.title: Privacy-First Design
strengths.description: The integration of zero-knowledge proofs and privacy-preserving technologies highlights a strong commitment to user privacy.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Detailed User-Centric Design
weaknesses.description: The application lacks specific details on how the project ensures a user-centric design, which is crucial for enhancing Web3 accessibility.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Metrics for Impact Measurement
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide clear metrics or methods for measuring the project's impact, which is important for evaluating its success.

changes.title: Provide Detailed User-Centric Design Information
changes.description: Include specific details on how the project ensures a user-centric design to enhance Web3 accessibility and usability.

changes.title: Define Metrics for Impact Measurement
changes.description: Outline clear metrics and methods for measuring the project's impact to better evaluate its success and scalability.
